newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian rupee recovers after RBI's dollar purchase.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee recovers after RBI's dollar purchase.

text.p: The Indian rupee gained to 35.81/82 against the dollar on Monday afternoon from the opening level of 35 83/84 despite an intervention by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) earlier in the day, dealers said.
They said RBI bought dollars at 35.81 and 35.82 levels.
Spot rupee moved by three paise from 35.81 to 35.83 on Monday, dealers said.
Forward dollar premiums showed a mild uptrend but were largely steady, they said.
